title: United States Supreme Court Building
summary: The Supreme Court Building houses the Supreme Court of the United States. Also referred to as "The Marble Palace,"[2] the building serves as the official workplace of the Chief Justice of the United States and the eight Associate Justices of the Supreme Court. It is located at 1 First Street in Northeast Washington, D.C., in the block immediately east of the United States Capitol and within a mile of the Library of Congress. The building is managed by the Architect of the Capitol. On May 4, 1987, the Supreme Court Building was designated a National Historic Landmark.[1][3][4]
